insert|place, fit, or push something into something else;put in
inside|the inner side or surface of something;situated on the inside
insight|the capacity to gain an accurate and deep understanding of someone or something;perception
insist|demand something forcefully, not accepting refusal;maintain something is the case
inspect|look at closely, typically to assess condition;examine officially
install|place or fix equipment in position for use;formally place someone in a new position
instance|an example or single occurrence of something;for example
instead|as an alternative to;in place of
institute|an organization having a particular purpose;begin or establish;a society
institution|a large, important organization such as a university or bank;an established law or practice
instruction|a direction or order;detailed information about how something should be done;teaching
instructor|a person who teaches something;a teacher or coach
instrument|a tool or implement, especially one for precision work;a musical device;a formal document
insurance|a practice by which a company provides a guarantee of compensation for specified loss, damage, illness, or death
intellectual|relating to the intellect;a person possessing a highly developed intellect;cerebral
intelligence|the ability to acquire and apply knowledge and skills;the collection of information of military or political value
intend|have a course of action as one's purpose or intention;plan;mean
intense|of extreme force, degree, or strength;having or showing strong feelings
intensity|the quality of being intense;the measurable amount of a property, such as force or brightness
intention|a thing intended;an aim or plan;purpose
interaction|reciprocal action or influence;communication or direct involvement with someone or something
interest|the feeling of wanting to know or learn about something;money paid for the use of money lent;a share in a company
interested|showing curiosity or concern about something;having a financial stake
interesting|arousing curiosity or interest;holding one's attention
internal|of or situated on the inside;relating to the domestic affairs of a country
international|existing or occurring between two or more nations;agreed on by all or many nations
internet|a global computer network providing a variety of information and communication facilities
interpret|explain the meaning of;translate orally;understand as having a particular meaning
interpretation|the action of explaining the meaning of something;a particular way of performing a piece of music or a role
interrupt|stop the continuous progress of an activity or process;break the continuity of
interval|an intervening time or space;a pause;a space between two things
interview|a meeting of people face to face, especially for consultation or to assess a candidate for a job
into|expressing movement or action with the result that someone or something becomes enclosed or surrounded
introduce|bring something into use or operation for the first time;make someone known by name to another
introduction|the action of introducing something;a formal presentation of one person to another;a preliminary part
invent|create or design something that has not existed before;make up a false story
invention|the action of inventing something;a thing that has been invented;a fabrication
invest|expend money with the expectation of achieving a profit;devote time or energy to an undertaking
investigate|carry out a systematic or formal inquiry to discover and examine the facts;research
investigation|the action of investigating;a formal inquiry or systematic study
investment|the action or process of investing money for profit;a thing that is worth buying because it may be profitable
investor|a person or organization that puts money into financial schemes with the expectation of achieving a profit
invite|make a polite, formal, or friendly request to someone to go somewhere or to do something;ask
involve|have or include something as a necessary part or result;cause to participate in an activity
iron|a strong, hard magnetic silvery-gray metal;a tool for pressing clothes;resolute
island|a piece of land surrounded by water;isle
issue|an important topic or problem for debate or discussion;the action of supplying or distributing an item;publish
it|used to refer to a thing previously mentioned or easily identified;the subject of an impersonal verb
item|an individual article or unit;a piece of news
its|belonging to or associated with a thing previously mentioned or easily identified
itself|used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to a thing or animal previously mentioned as the subject of the clause
jacket|an outer garment extending to the waist or hips;a protective cover
jam|a sweet spread made from fruit;become stuck or wedged;a crowded mass of people or vehicles
jar|a wide-mouthed cylindrical container made of glass or pottery;a sudden jolting movement
jaw|the upper or lower bony structure in vertebrates, forming the framework of the mouth
jazz|a type of music of black American origin characterized by improvisation and a strong rhythm
jealous|feeling or showing envy of someone's achievements or advantages;fiercely protective
jeans|hard-wearing trousers made of denim or other cotton fabric
jet|a rapid stream of liquid or gas;an aircraft powered by jet engines
jewel|a precious stone;a person or thing that is highly valued
jewelry|personal ornaments, such as necklaces, rings, or bracelets
job|a paid position of regular employment;a task or piece of work
join|link;connect;become a member of;unite
joint|a point at which parts of a structure are joined;a structure where two bones are fitted together;shared
joke|a thing that someone says to cause amusement or laughter;a trick played for fun
journal|a newspaper or magazine that deals with a particular subject;a daily record of news and events
journalism|the activity of writing for newspapers, magazines, or news websites
journalist|a person who writes for newspapers, magazines, or news websites
journey|an act of traveling from one place to another;a trip;an expedition
joy|a feeling of great pleasure and happiness;delight;felicity
judge|a public official appointed to decide cases in a court of law;form an opinion about;evaluate
judgment|the ability to make considered decisions;a decision of a court of law
juice|the liquid obtained from or present in fruit or vegetables
july|the seventh month of the year
jump|push oneself off a surface and into the air;a sudden startled movement
june|the sixth month of the year
jungle|an area of land overgrown with dense forest and tangled vegetation
junior|of or for younger or less experienced people;a person with a lower rank
jury|a body of people sworn to give a verdict in a legal case on the basis of evidence submitted to them
just|based on or behaving according to what is morally right and fair;exactly;very recently;only
justice|just behavior or treatment;the quality of being fair and reasonable;the administration of the law
justify|show or prove to be right or reasonable;be a good reason for
keen|having or showing eagerness;enthusiastic;sharp;intellectually acute
keep|have or retain possession of;continue in a specified condition;care for
kettle|a container with a spout and handle, used for boiling water;pot
key|a small piece of shaped metal for operating a lock;a thing that provides a means of achieving something;of crucial importance;button on a keyboard
keyboard|a panel of keys for operating a computer, typewriter, or musical instrument
kick|strike forcefully with the foot;a sudden thrill of excitement;recoil of a gun
kid|a child or young person;a young goat;joke or tease someone
kill|cause the death of;put an end to an activity;overwhelm someone with an emotion
kilometer|a metric unit of measurement equal to 1,000 meters (approximately 0.62 miles)
kind|having a friendly or generous nature;a class of people or things with similar characteristics;type;sort
king|the male ruler of an independent state, especially one who inherits the position;monarch
kingdom|a country or state ruled by a king or queen;a realm associated with a particular quality
kiss|touch with the lips as a sign of love or greeting;a gentle touch
kit|a set of articles or equipment needed for a specific purpose;outfit
kitchen|a room equipped for preparing and cooking food
knee|the joint between the thigh and the lower leg in humans
knife|an instrument with a blade for cutting, consisting of a handle and blade
knock|strike a surface noisily to attract attention;collide with someone or something;make a tapping sound
knot|a fastening made by looping a piece of rope on itself and tightening it;a tangled mass;a hard mass in wood
know|have knowledge or be aware of through observation or information;be acquainted with
knowledge|facts, information, and skills acquired through experience or education;awareness or familiarity gained by experience
label|a small piece of paper or other material attached to an object to give information about it;a classifying name or phrase
labor|work, especially hard physical work;the process of childbirth
laboratory|a room or building equipped for scientific experiments, research, or teaching
lack|the state of being without or not having enough of something;deficiency
ladder|a piece of equipment with horizontal rungs for climbing up or down
lady|a woman of good social position;a polite or formal way of referring to a woman
lake|a large area of water surrounded by land
lamp|a device for giving light, either electric or fueled by oil or gas
land|the part of the earth's surface that is not covered by water;come ashore or bring an aircraft down
landscape|all the visible features of an area of countryside or land
lane|a narrow road, especially in a rural area;a division of a road for a single line of traffic
language|the method of human communication, either spoken or written, consisting of the use of words in a structured way
lap|the flat area between the waist and knees of a seated person;one circuit of a racetrack
large|of considerable or relatively great size, extent, or capacity;big
largely|to a great extent;on the whole;mostly
last|coming after all others in time or order;final;continue for a specified period of time
late|doing something or happening after the expected or usual time;tardy
lately|in the recent past;not long ago;recently
later|at a time in the future or after the time you have mentioned;subsequently
laugh|make the spontaneous sounds and movements of the face and body that are the instinctive expressions of lively amusement
launch|set a boat in motion by pushing it into the water;start or set in motion an activity or enterprise
law|the system of rules which a particular country or community recognizes as regulating the actions of its members
lawyer|a person who practices or studies law;an attorney or a counselor
lay|put down, especially gently or carefully;put down and set in position for use
layer|a sheet, quantity, or thickness of material, typically one of several, covering a surface
lazy|unwilling to work or use energy;idle;slothful
lead|cause to go with one by holding them by the hand or a rope;be in charge of;a soft heavy toxic metallic element
leader|the person who leads or commands a group, organization, or country
leadership|the action of leading a group of people or an organization;the state or position of being a leader
leading|most important;in the winning position;principal
leaf|a flattened structure of a higher plant, typically green and blade-like, that is attached to a stem
league|a collection of people, countries, or groups that combine for a particular purpose;a class of contestants
lean|be in or move into a sloping position;thin and healthy;rely on for support
learn|gain or acquire knowledge of or skill in something by study, experience, or being taught
learning|the acquisition of knowledge or skills through study, experience, or being taught;knowledge acquired
least|smallest in amount, extent, or significance;minimum
leather|a material made from the tanned skin of an animal
leave|go away from;allow to remain;depart;permission to be absent
lecture|an educational talk to an audience, especially one of students in a university
left|on, toward, or relating to the side of a human body which is to the west when the person is facing north
leg|each of the limbs on which a person or animal walks and stands
legal|relating to the law;permitted by law;lawful
legend|a traditional story sometimes popularly regarded as historical but unauthenticated;an extremely famous person
leisure|free time used for enjoyment
lemon|a yellow, oval citrus fruit with thick skin and acidic juice
lend|grant to someone the use of something on the understanding that it will be returned;loan
length|the measurement or extent of something from end to end
less|a smaller amount of;not as much

let|not prevent or forbid;allow;permit

level|a horizontal plane or line with respect to the distance above or below a given point;a position on a scale

library|a building or room containing collections of books, periodicals, and sometimes films and recorded music for use or borrowing
license|a permit from an authority to own or use something, do a particular thing, or carry on a trade
lid|a removable or hinged cover for the top of a container
lie|be in or assume a horizontal or resting position;an intentionally false statement
life|the condition that distinguishes animals and plants from inorganic matter, including the capacity for growth and reproduction
lifestyle|the way in which a person or group lives

light|the natural agent that stimulates sight and makes things visible;not heavy;illuminate
like|having the same characteristics or qualities as;find agreeable or enjoyable;similar to
likely|such as well might happen or be true;probable
limit|a point or level beyond which something does not or may not extend;a restriction

link|a relationship between two things or situations;a connection or loop in a chain
lip|each of the two fleshy parts which form the upper and lower edges of the opening of the mouth
liquid|a substance that flows freely but is of constant volume, having a consistency like that of water or oil

live|remain alive;make one's home in a particular place;reside

loss|the fact or process of losing something or someone;the feeling of grief after losing someone

loud|producing or capable of producing much noise;with a great deal of volume

low|of less than average height from top to bottom;not high in status
loyal|giving or showing firm and constant support or allegiance to a person or institution;faithful

lunch|a meal eaten in the middle of the day

mail|letters and parcels sent by post;email
main|chief in size or importance;principal;a principal pipe or duct in a system
mainly|for the most part;chiefly;primarily

major|important, serious, or significant;a high rank in the army;a student's principal subject of study

male|of or denoting the sex that produces sperm;a male person or animal

maximum|as great, high, or intense as possible or permitted;the greatest amount

meat|the flesh of an animal as food

mental|relating to the mind;relating to disorders of the mind

mere|that is solely or no more or better than what is specified;the smallest or slightest

mess|a dirty or untidy state of things or of a place;a difficult or confusing situation
message|a verbal, written, or recorded communication sent to or left for a recipient who cannot be contacted directly
metal|a solid material which is typically hard, shiny, malleable, and a good electrical and thermal conductor
meter|the fundamental unit of length in the metric system, equal to 100 centimeters
method|a particular procedure for accomplishing or approaching something
middle|at an equal distance from the extremities of a thing;the central point, position, or part
midnight|twelve o'clock at night;the middle of the night

mind|the element of a person that enables them to be aware of the world and their experiences;object to something
mine|used to refer to a thing belonging to the speaker;an excavation in the earth for extracting coal or other minerals

mistake|an action or judgment that is misguided or wrong;an error
mix|combine or put together to form one substance or mass;socialize

mobile|able to move or be moved freely or easily;a cell phone
mode|a way or manner in which something occurs or is experienced;a fashion or style

modern|relating to the present or recent times as opposed to the remote past
moment|a very brief period of time;an exact point in time
money|a current medium of exchange in the form of coins and banknotes

more|a greater or additional amount or degree
morning|the period of time between midnight and noon, especially from sunrise to noon
most|greatest in amount or degree;the majority of
mostly|mainly;for the most part
mother|a female parent
motion|the action or process of moving or being moved;a formal proposal put to a legislature or committee
motivation|the reason or reasons one has for acting or behaving in a particular way;enthusiasm

mountain|a large natural elevation of the earth's surface rising abruptly from the surrounding level

mouth|the opening in the lower part of the human face, through which food is taken in;the opening of a river or cave
move|go in a specified direction or manner;change position;a change of place or position
movement|an act of changing physical location or position;a group of people working together to advance their shared ideas
movie|a film shown in a theater or on television
much|a large amount
mud|soft, sticky matter resulting from the mixing of earth and water
multiple|having or involving several parts, elements, or members
murder|the unlawful premeditated killing of one human being by another
muscle|a band of fibrous tissue in a human or animal body that has the ability to contract, producing movement
museum|a building in which objects of historical, scientific, artistic, or cultural interest are stored and exhibited
music|vocal or instrumental sounds combined in such a way as to produce beauty of form, harmony, and expression of emotion
musical|relating to music;a play or film in which singing and dancing play an essential part
must|be obliged to;should;an essential requirement
mutual|experienced or done by each of two or more parties toward the other or others;shared
my|belonging to or associated with the speaker
myself|used by a speaker to refer to themself as the object of a verb or preposition when they are also the subject
mystery|something that is difficult or impossible to understand or explain

nail|a small metal spike;a horny covering on the upper surface of the tip of the finger and toe;fasten with a nail

name|a word by which a person, animal, place, or thing is known;give a name to;a reputation
narrative|a spoken or written account of connected events;a story;the telling of a story
narrow|of small width;limited in extent, amount, or scope;become or make less wide
nation|a large body of people united by common descent, history, culture, or language, inhabiting a particular country
national|relating to a nation;common to a whole nation
native|a person born in a specified place;associated with the place of a person's birth;innate
natural|existing in or derived from nature;not made by humankind;in accordance with the nature of a person
naturally|in a natural manner;as might be expected;of course
nature|the phenomena of the physical world collectively;the basic or inherent features of something;character
navy|the branch of a nation's armed services that conducts military operations at sea
near|at or to a short distance away;a short time away;almost
nearby|not far away;close
nearly|very close to;almost
neat|arranged in a tidy way;in good order;done with skill
necessarily|as a necessary result;inevitably

neck|the part of a person's or animal's body connecting the head to the rest of the body
need|require something because it is essential or very important;a thing that is wanted or required
needle|a small slender tool with a pointed end and a hole for thread;the pointed indicator on a dial
negative|consisting in or characterized by the absence rather than the presence of distinguishing features;a word expressing denial;a photographic image showing light and shade reversed
negotiate|try to reach an agreement or compromise by discussion with others;find a way over or through an obstacle

neighbor|a person living next door to or very near to the user

neither|not the one nor the other of two people or things
nerve|a fiber or bundle of fibers that transmits impulses of sensation to the brain or spinal cord;courage
nervous|easily agitated or alarmed;anxious or apprehensive;relating to the nerves
net|a piece of open-meshed material;an amount remaining after deductions;the internet
network|an arrangement of intersecting horizontal and vertical lines;a group of interconnected people or things
never|at no time in the past or future;not ever
nevertheless|in spite of that;however;nonetheless
new|not existing before;made, introduced, or discovered recently
newly|recently;afresh;anew
news|newly received or noteworthy information, especially about recent events
newspaper|a printed publication consisting of folded unstapled sheets and containing news, articles, advertisements, and correspondence
next|coming immediately after the present one in time, order, or space;adjacent
nice|pleasant;attractive;delightful;kind
night|the period of darkness in each twenty-four hours;the time from sunset to sunrise
nine|the number equivalent to the sum of six and three;9
no|not any;a negative used to express dissent, denial, or refusal
nobody|no person;no one;a person of no importance
noise|a sound, especially one that is loud or unpleasant or that causes disturbance
none|not any;no one
nor|used before the second of two alternatives when the first is introduced by 'neither'
normal|conforming to a standard;usual, typical, or expected
normally|under normal or usual conditions;usually
north|the direction in which a compass needle normally points, toward the horizon on the left-hand side of a person facing east
northern|situated in or directed toward the north
nose|the part of the face which projects above the mouth and contains the nostrils, used for breathing and smelling
not|used with an auxiliary verb or 'be' to form the negative
note|a brief record of facts, topics, or thoughts;a single tone of definite pitch;a short informal letter
nothing|not anything;no single thing;of no importance
notice|the fact of observing or paying attention to something;become aware of;a formal announcement
notion|a conception of or belief about something;an idea;a whim
novel|a fictitious prose narrative of book length;new or unusual in an interesting way
november|the eleventh month of the year
now|at the present time or moment
nowhere|not in or to any place
nuclear|relating to the nucleus of an atom;relating to weapons developed from nuclear energy
number|an arithmetical value, expressed by a word, symbol, or figure, representing a particular quantity
numerous|great in number;many
nurse|a person trained to care for the sick or infirm, especially in a hospital
nut|a fruit consisting of a hard or tough shell around an edible kernel
object|a material thing that can be seen and touched;a person or thing to which an action or feeling is directed;express disapproval
objective|a thing aimed at or sought;a goal;not influenced by personal feelings or opinions
obligation|a duty or commitment;the condition of being morally or legally bound to do something
observation|the action of observing something carefully in order to gain information;a remark or statement
observe|notice or perceive something;watch carefully;make a remark
observer|a person who watches or notices something;a person who attends a formal meeting without participating
obtain|get, acquire, or secure something
obvious|easily perceived or understood;clear, self-evident, or apparent
obviously|in a way that is easily perceived or understood;clearly
occasion|a particular time or instance of an event;a special event
occasionally|at infrequent or irregular intervals;now and then
occupation|a job or profession;the action of living in or using a building or area
occupy|reside or have one's place of business in a building;fill or take up a space, time, or position
occur|happen;take place;be found or present in a particular place or situation
ocean|a very large expanse of sea, in particular each of the main areas into which the sea is divided geographically
oclock|used to specify the hour when telling time
october|the tenth month of the year
odd|different from what is usual or expected;strange;a number that is not divisible by two
of|expressing the relationship between a part and a whole;indicating an association
off|away from the place in question;to a distance;no longer operating or connected
offense|a breach of a law or rule;an illegal act;annoyance or resentment brought about by a perceived insult
offer|present something for someone to accept or reject;an expression of readiness to do or give something
office|a room or building used as a place for commercial or professional work;a position of authority
officer|a person holding a position of command or authority in the armed services, the police, or a government department
official|relating to an authority or public body;a person holding public office
often|frequently;many times
oil|a viscous liquid derived from petroleum, especially for use as a fuel or lubricant;a fatty substance obtained from animals or plants
ok|used to express assent, agreement, or acceptance;all right
old|having lived for a long time;no longer young;belonging to the past
on|physically in contact with and supported by a surface;forming a part of a surface
once|on one occasion or for one time only;at some time in the past
one|the lowest cardinal number;half of two;a single person or thing
ongoing|continuing;still in progress
onion|a vegetable with a pungent taste and smell, composed of several concentric layers
online|connected to, served by, or available through a computer or telecommunications system, especially the internet
only|and no one or nothing more besides;solely;just
onto|moving to a position on the surface of something
open|allowing access, passage, or a view through an empty space;not closed or blocked up;begin
opening|a gap or aperture allowing access;a beginning;an opportunity
operate|control the functioning of a machine, process, or system;perform a surgical operation
operation|the action of functioning or the fact of being active or in effect;an act of surgery
operator|a person who operates equipment or a machine
opinion|a view or judgment formed about something, not necessarily based on fact or knowledge
opponent|someone who competes with or opposes another in a contest, game, or argument
opportunity|a set of circumstances that makes it possible to do something;a chance
oppose|disapprove of and attempt to prevent, especially by argument;actively resist
opposite|situated on the other or further side when seen from a particular point;completely different
opposition|resistance or dissent, expressed in action or argument;a group of opponents
option|a thing that is or may be chosen;the freedom or right to choose
or|used to link alternatives
orange|a large round juicy citrus fruit with a tough bright reddish-yellow rind;a reddish-yellow color
order|the arrangement of people or things in relation to each other;an authoritative command;a request for something to be made or supplied
ordinary|with no special or distinctive features;normal;common
organ|a part of an organism that is typically self-contained and has a specific vital function;a large musical keyboard instrument
organization|an organized body of people with a particular purpose, such as a business or government department
organize|arrange into a structured whole;order;coordinate the activities of
origin|the point or place where something begins, arises, or is derived
original|present or existing from the beginning;first or earliest;not a copy
originally|from or in the beginning;at first
other|used to refer to a person or thing that is different from one already mentioned;alternative
otherwise|in circumstances different from those present or considered;or else;in other respects
ought|used to indicate duty or correctness, typically when criticizing someone's actions
our|belonging to or associated with the speaker and one or more other people previously mentioned or easily identified
ourselves|used by a speaker to refer to themself and one or more other people as the object of a verb or preposition
out|moving or appearing to move away from a particular place;not at home or at one's place of work
outcome|the way a thing turns out;a consequence;a result
outside|the external side or surface of something;situated on or near the exterior
oven|an enclosed compartment, usually part of a cooker, for baking or heating food
over|extending directly upward from;at a higher level;above;finished
overall|taking everything into account;as a whole;a garment consisting of trousers with a bib attached
overcome|succeed in dealing with a problem or difficulty;defeat
owe|have an obligation to pay or repay something, especially money, in return for something received
own|have something as one's own;possess;admit or acknowledge that something is the case
owner|a person who owns something
pace|a single step taken when walking or running;a consistent speed in running or working
pack|a container, especially a bundle or box;a group of wild animals, especially wolves;fill a container
package|an object or group of objects wrapped in paper or packed in a box
page|one side of a sheet of paper in a book, magazine, or newspaper
pain|a highly unpleasant physical sensation caused by illness or injury;mental suffering
paint|a colored substance which is spread over a surface and dries to leave a thin decorative or protective coating
painting|the action or skill of using paint;a painted picture
pair|a set of two things used together or regarded as a unit
palace|the official residence of a sovereign or other exalted person
pale|light in color or having little color;feeble or unimpressive
pan|a metal container used for cooking food in
panel|a flat component that forms part of a larger object;a small group of people brought together to discuss or decide something
pants|an outer garment covering the body from the waist to the ankles, with a separate part for each leg;trousers
paper|material manufactured in thin sheets from wood pulp, used for writing, printing, or as wrapping material
parent|a father or mother;an ancestor
park|a large public garden in a town, used for recreation;bring a vehicle to a halt and leave it temporarily
parliament|the highest legislature, consisting of the sovereign, the House of Lords, and the House of Commons
part|a piece or portion of something;some but not all of something
participate|take part in an action or event
particular|relating to one specific person or thing;special;insisting that something should be correct
particularly|to a higher degree than is usual;especially
partner|a person who takes part in an undertaking with another or others, especially in a business
party|a social gathering of invited guests;a formally constituted political group
pass|move or cause to move in a specified direction;go past or across;succeed in an examination
passage|the action of moving through or past something;a narrow way allowing access between buildings
passenger|a traveler on a public or private conveyance other than the driver, pilot, or crew
passion|strong and barely controllable emotion;an intense desire or enthusiasm for something
past|gone by in time and no longer existing;the time before the moment of speaking or writing
patch|a piece of cloth used to mend a tear;a small area differing from the rest;a small plot of land
path|a way or track laid down for walking or made by continual treading
patient|able to accept or tolerate delays or problems without becoming annoyed;a person receiving medical treatment
pattern|a repeated decorative design;a model or design used as a guide
pause|interrupt action or speech briefly;a temporary stop
pay|give someone money that is due for work done, goods received, or a debt incurred
payment|the action or process of paying someone or something;an amount paid
peace|freedom from disturbance;tranquility;a state or period in which there is no war
peak|the pointed top of a mountain;the point of highest activity, achievement, or intensity
pen|an instrument for writing or drawing with ink
penalty|a punishment imposed for breaking a law, rule, or contract
pencil|an instrument for writing or drawing, consisting of a thin stick of graphite enclosed in wood
penny|a British bronze coin and monetary unit equal to one-hundredth of a pound
people|human beings in general or considered collectively;the persons of a particular nation or ethnic group
pepper|a pungent, hot-tasting powder prepared from dried and ground peppercorns, used as a spice
per|for each (used with units to express a rate)
perceive|become aware or conscious of something;come to realize or understand
percentage|a rate, number, or amount in each hundred
perception|the ability to see, hear, or become aware of something through the senses;a way of regarding something
perfect|having all the required or desirable elements, qualities, or characteristics;as good as it is possible to be
perfectly|in a perfect way;completely;absolutely
perform|carry out, accomplish, or fulfill an action, task, or function
performance|an act of staging or presenting a play, concert, or other form of entertainment;the action or process of carrying out a task
perhaps|possibly but not certainly;maybe
period|a length or portion of time;a punctuation mark (.) indicating the end of a sentence
permanent|lasting or intended to last or remain unchanged indefinitely
permission|official consent;authorization
permit|officially allow someone to do something;an official document giving someone authorization
person|a human being regarded as an individual
personal|of, affecting, or belonging to a particular person rather than to anyone else
personality|the combination of characteristics or qualities that form an individual's distinctive character
personally|by a particular person and not someone else;in one's own opinion
perspective|a particular attitude toward or way of regarding something;a point of view
persuade|cause someone to do something through reasoning or argument
pet|a domestic or tamed animal kept for companionship or pleasure
phase|a distinct period or stage in a series of events or a process of change or development
philosophy|the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence
phone|a telephone;make a telephone call to
photo|a photograph
photograph|a picture made using a camera, in which an image is focused onto film or other light-sensitive material
phrase|a small group of words standing together as a conceptual unit, typically forming a component of a clause
physical|relating to the body as opposed to the mind;relating to things perceived through the senses
physically|in a way that relates to the body or to the laws of nature
physics|the branch of science concerned with the nature and properties of matter and energy
piano|a large keyboard musical instrument with a wooden case enclosing a soundboard and metal strings
pick|choose someone or something from a number of alternatives;detach and remove a flower or fruit from where it is growing
picture|a painting, drawing, or photograph of someone or something
piece|a part or portion of something;a musical or written work
pig|a domestic swine, kept for its meat
pile|a heap of things laid or lying one on top of another
pilot|a person who operates the flying controls of an aircraft
pin|a thin piece of metal with a sharp point at one end and a round head at the other, used as a fastener
pink|a color intermediate between red and white, as of pale roses
pipe|a tube of metal, plastic, or other material used to convey water, gas, oil, or other fluid substances
pitch|the quality of a sound governed by the rate of vibrations producing it;the degree of highness or lowness of a tone;throw a ball
place|a particular position or point in space;a portion of space occupied by or set aside for someone or something
plan|a detailed proposal for doing or achieving something;an intention or decision about what one is going to do
plane|a flat surface on which a straight line joining any two points on it would wholly lie;an airplane
planet|a celestial body moving in an elliptical orbit around a star
planning|the process of making plans for something
plant|a living organism of the kind exemplified by trees, shrubs, herbs, etc.;place a seed or plant in the ground to grow
plastic|a synthetic material made from a wide range of organic polymers that can be molded into shape while soft
plate|a flat dish, typically circular, from which food is eaten or served
platform|a raised level surface on which people or things can stand
play|engage in activity for enjoyment and recreation;a dramatic work for the stage or to be broadcast
player|a person taking part in a sport or game
please|cause to feel happy and satisfied;a polite word used in a request
pleasure|a feeling of happy satisfaction and enjoyment
plenty|a large or sufficient amount or quantity;more than enough
plot|the main events of a play, novel, or similar work;a plan made in secret by a group of people to do something illegal
plus|with the addition of;an advantage
pocket|a small bag sewn into or on clothing, so as to form part of it, used for carrying small articles
poem|a piece of writing in which the expression of feelings and ideas is given intensity by the use of distinctive style and rhythm
poet|a person who writes poems
poetry|literary work in which the expression of feelings and ideas is given intensity by the use of distinctive style and rhythm
point|the tapered, sharp end of a tool or weapon;a particular spot, place, or position;direct someone's attention to something
pole|a long, slender, rounded piece of wood or metal, typically used as a support
police|the civil force of a state, responsible for the prevention and detection of crime and the maintenance of public order
policy|a course or principle of action adopted or proposed by a government, party, business, or individual
political|relating to the government or public affairs of a country
politically|in a way that relates to politics or the public affairs of a country
politician|a person who is professionally involved in politics, especially as a holder of an elected office
politics|the activities associated with the governance of a country or other area
poll|the process of voting in an election;a survey of public opinion
pollution|the presence in or introduction into the environment of a substance which has harmful or poisonous effects
pool|a small area of still water, either natural or artificial;a swimming pool;a supply of shared resources
poor|lacking sufficient money to live at a standard considered comfortable or normal;of a low or inferior standard
pop|make a light explosive sound;popular music
popular|liked, admired, or enjoyed by many people or by a particular person or group
population|all the inhabitants of a particular town, area, or country
port|a town or city with a harbor where ships load or unload
pose|present or constitute a problem or danger;assume a particular attitude or position in order to be photographed or painted
position|a place where someone or something is located or has been put;a particular way in which someone or something is placed or arranged
positive|consisting in or characterized by the presence of features rather than their absence;constructive and optimistic
possess|have as belonging to one;own;have a quality or feature
possession|the state of having, owning, or controlling something
possibility|a thing that may happen or be the case;the state or fact of being possible
possible|able to be done or achieved
possibly|perhaps;maybe
post|a long, sturdy piece of timber or metal set upright in the ground;the official service that delivers letters and parcels;publish something online
pot|a rounded or cylindrical container, used for storage or cooking
potato|a starchy plant tuber which is one of the most important food crops, cooked and eaten as a vegetable
potential|having or showing the capacity to become or develop into something in the future;latent qualities
pound|a unit of weight equal to 16 oz;the basic monetary unit of the UK;strike or hit heavily and repeatedly
pour|flow rapidly in a steady stream;dispense a drink into a container
poverty|the state of being extremely poor
powder|a dry, fine substance obtained by grinding, crushing, or disintegrating a solid substance
power|the ability to do something or act in a particular way;the capacity to influence the behavior of others
powerful|having great power or strength
practical|of or concerned with the actual doing or use of something rather than with theory and ideas
practice|the actual application or use of an idea or method;perform an activity repeatedly in order to improve
pray|address a solemn request or expression of thanks to a deity or other object of worship
prayer|a solemn request for help or expression of thanks addressed to God or another deity
precisely|in exact terms;without vagueness;exactly
predict|say or estimate that a specified thing will happen in the future or will be a consequence of something
prefer|like one thing or person better than another or others;tend to choose
preference|a greater liking for one alternative over another or others
pregnancy|the condition or period of being pregnant
pregnant|having a child or young developing in the uterus
preparation|the action or process of making ready or being made ready for use or consideration
prepare|make something ready for use or consideration;make oneself ready
prescription|an instruction written by a medical practitioner that authorizes a patient to be provided a medicine or treatment
presence|the state or fact of existing, occurring, or being present in a place or thing
present|in a particular place;existing or occurring now;a thing given to someone as a gift;introduce
presentation|the giving of something to someone;a speech or talk in which a new product, idea, or piece of work is shown
preserve|maintain something in its original or existing state;treat food to prevent its decomposition
president|the elected head of a republican state
press|move into a position of contact with something by exerting continuous physical force;newspapers or journalists viewed collectively
pressure|continuous physical force exerted on or against an object by something in contact with it;the use of persuasion or intimidation to make someone do something
pretend|speak and act so as to make it appear that something is the case when in fact it is not
pretty|attractive in a delicate way without being truly beautiful;to a moderately high degree
prevent|keep something from happening or arising
previous|existing or occurring before in time or order
previously|at a previous or earlier time;before
price|the amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something
pride|a feeling of deep pleasure or satisfaction derived from one's own achievements or qualities
priest|an ordained minister of the Catholic, Orthodox, or Anglican Church having the authority to perform certain rites
primarily|for the most part;mainly
primary|of chief importance;principal;earliest in time or order
prime|of first importance;main;of the best possible quality
prince|the son of a monarch
princess|the daughter of a monarch
principal|first in order of importance;main;the head of a school
principle|a fundamental truth or proposition that serves as the foundation for a system of belief or behavior
print|produce books, newspapers, etc., by a process involving the transfer of text or images to paper
prior|existing or coming before in time, order, or importance
priority|a thing that is regarded as more important than another
prison|a building in which people are legally held as a punishment for a crime or while awaiting trial
prisoner|a person legally held in prison as a punishment for a crime or while awaiting trial
privacy|a state in which one is not observed or disturbed by other people
private|for or concerning an individual person or group rather than the public
probably|almost certainly;as far as one knows or can tell
problem|a matter or situation regarded as unwelcome or harmful and needing to be dealt with and overcome
procedure|an established or official way of doing something
proceed|begin or continue a course of action
process|a series of actions or steps taken in order to achieve a particular end
produce|make or manufacture from components or raw materials;cause a particular result
producer|a person, company, or country that makes, grows, or supplies goods or commodities for sale
product|an article or substance that is manufactured or refined for sale
production|the action of making or manufacturing from components or raw materials;the amount of something made
profession|a paid occupation, especially one that involves prolonged training and a formal qualification
professional|relating to or belonging to a profession;a person engaged in a specified activity as one's main paid occupation
professor|a university academic of the highest rank;a teacher of the highest rank
profile|an outline of something, especially a person's face, as seen from one side;a short article giving a description of a person
profit|a financial gain, especially the difference between the amount earned and the amount spent
program|a planned series of future events or performances;a set of related measures or activities with a particular long-term aim;a series of coded software instructions to control a computer
progress|forward or onward movement toward a destination;development towards an improved condition
project|an individual or collaborative enterprise that is carefully planned to achieve a particular aim;estimate or forecast on the basis of present trends
prominent|important;famous;projecting from something
promise|a declaration or assurance that one will do a particular thing or that a particular thing will happen
promote|further the progress of something;raise someone to a higher position or rank
prompt|cause or bring about an action or feeling;done without delay;immediate
proof|evidence or argument establishing or helping to establish a fact or the truth of a statement
proper|truly what something is said to be;genuine;appropriate or correct
properly|correctly or satisfactorily;in the right way
property|a thing or things belonging to someone;possessions collectively;an attribute or quality
proportion|a part, share, or number considered in comparative relation to a whole
proposal|a plan or suggestion, especially a formal or written one, put forward for consideration
propose|put forward an idea or plan for consideration or discussion by others
proposed|suggested as a possible plan or action for consideration
prospect|the possibility or likelihood of some future event occurring
protect|keep safe from harm or injury
protection|the action of protecting, or the state of being protected
protein|any of a class of nitrogenous organic compounds which have large molecules and are an essential part of all living organisms
protest|a statement or action expressing disapproval of or objection to something
proud|feeling deep pleasure or satisfaction as a result of one's own achievements, qualities, or possessions
prove|demonstrate the truth or existence of something by evidence or argument
provide|make available for use;supply
provider|a person or thing that provides something
province|a principal administrative division of certain countries or empires
provision|the action of providing or supplying something for use;a condition in a legal document
psychological|of, affecting, or arising in the mind;related to the mental and emotional state of a person
psychologist|an expert or specialist in psychology
psychology|the scientific study of the human mind and its functions, especially those affecting behavior in a given context
public|of or concerning the people as a whole;open to all
publication|the preparation and issuing of a book, journal, piece of music, or other work for public sale
publicly|so as to be seen by other people;in public;openly
publish|prepare and issue a book, journal, etc. for public sale
publisher|a person or company that prepares and issues books, journals, music, or other works for sale
pull|exert force on someone or something so as to cause movement toward oneself
punishment|the infliction or imposition of a penalty as retribution for an offense
purchase|acquire something by paying for it;buy
pure|not mixed or adulterated with any other substance or material
purpose|the reason for which something is done or created or for which something exists
pursue|follow someone or something in order to catch or attack them;continue or proceed along a path
push|exert force on someone or something in order to move them away from oneself
put|move to or place in a particular position
qualification|a quality or accomplishment that makes someone suitable for a particular job or activity;the action of qualifying
qualify|be entitled to a particular benefit or privilege by fulfilling a necessary condition;be or make competent for a particular job
quality|the standard of something as measured against other things of a similar kind;a distinctive attribute or characteristic
quantity|the amount or number of a material or abstract thing that can be measured
quarter|each of four equal or corresponding parts into which something is divided;a period of three months;a coin worth 25 cents
queen|the female ruler of an independent state, especially one who inherits the position by right of birth
question|a sentence worded or expressed so as to elicit information;a matter forming the basis of a problem or argument;ask someone questions
quick|moving fast or doing something in a short time;prompt
quickly|at a fast speed;rapidly
quiet|making little or no noise;free from activity or disturbance
quietly|in a way that makes little or no noise;without attracting attention
quit|leave a place, usually permanently;stop or discontinue an action or activity
quite|to the greatest extent;completely;to a certain or significant extent;moderately
quote|repeat or copy out a group of words from a text or speech, typically with an indication that one is not the original author or speaker;a quotation
race|a competition between runners, horses, vehicles, etc., to see which is the fastest;each of the major divisions of humankind
racial|relating to race or the relations between different racial groups
radical|relating to or affecting the fundamental nature of something;far-reaching;advocating thorough political or social reform
radio|the transmission and reception of electromagnetic waves, especially those carrying sound messages
rail|a bar or series of bars fixed on upright supports or posts as part of a fence or as a barrier
rain|moisture condensed from the atmosphere that falls visibly in separate drops
raise|lift or move to a higher position or level;bring up a child;increase the amount or level of something
range|the area of variation between upper and lower limits on a particular scale;a set of different things of the same general type
rank|a position in the hierarchy of an organization, especially the armed forces
rapid|happening in a short time or at a fast pace;swift
rapidly|very quickly;at a great rate
rare|not occurring very often;uncommon
rarely|not often;seldom
rate|a measure, quantity, or frequency, typically one measured against some other quantity or measure
rather|used to express a preference;to a certain extent
rating|a classification or ranking of someone or something based on a comparative assessment of their quality
ratio|the quantitative relation between two amounts showing the number of times one value contains or is contained within the other
raw|not cooked;in its natural state;unprocessed
reach|stretch out an arm in a specified direction in order to touch or grasp something;arrive at a place
react|act in response to something;respond in a particular way
reaction|an action performed or a feeling experienced in response to a situation or event
read|look at and comprehend the meaning of written or printed matter
reader|a person who reads or who is fond of reading
reading|the action or skill of reading;material that is read
ready|in a suitable state for an action or situation;fully prepared
real|actually existing as a thing or occurring in fact;not imagined or supposed;genuine
reality|the state of things as they actually exist, as opposed to an idealistic or notional idea of them
realize|become fully aware of something as a fact;understand clearly;achieve something desired
really|in actual fact, as opposed to what is said or imagined;in truth;very
reason|a cause, explanation, or justification for an action or event;the power of the mind to think and understand logically
reasonable|having sound judgment;fair and sensible;as much as is appropriate or fair
recall|bring a fact, event, or situation back into one's mind;remember
receive|be given, presented with, or paid something
recent|having happened, begun, or been done not long ago
recently|not long ago;at a recent time
reception|the action or process of receiving something sent or given;a formal social occasion
recipe|a set of instructions for preparing a particular dish, including a list of the ingredients required
recognize|identify someone or something from having encountered them before;acknowledge the existence or validity of
recommend|put forward someone or something with approval as being suitable for a particular purpose or role
recommendation|a suggestion or proposal as to the best course of action
record|a thing constituting a piece of evidence about the past;set down in writing or some other permanent form for later reference
recording|the action or process of recording sound or a performance for subsequent reproduction or broadcast
recover|return to a normal state of health, mind, or strength
recovery|a return to a normal state of health, mind, or strength
recruit|enlist someone in the armed forces;a new member of a group or organization
red|of a color at the end of the spectrum next to orange and opposite violet, as of blood
reduce|make smaller or less in amount, degree, or size
reduction|the action or fact of making a specified thing smaller or less in amount, degree, or size
refer|mention or allude to;pass a matter to an authority for a decision
reference|the action of mentioning or alluding to something;a source of information
reflect|throw back heat, light, or sound without absorbing it;think deeply or carefully about
reflection|the throwing back by a body or surface of light, heat, or sound;serious thought or consideration
reform|make changes in something, typically a social or political institution, in order to improve it
refugee|a person who has been forced to leave their country in order to escape war, persecution, or natural disaster
refuse|indicate or show that one is not willing to do something;indicate that one is not willing to accept something
regard|consider or think of in a specified way;attention to or concern for something
regarding|in respect of;concerning
regardless|without paying attention to the present situation;despite the circumstances
regime|a government, especially an authoritarian one
region|an area of a country or the world having definable characteristics but not always fixed boundaries
regional|of or relating to a region
register|enter or record on an official list or directory;an official list or record
regular|arranged in or constituting a constant or definite pattern;done or happening frequently
regularly|at uniform intervals of time or space;often
regulate|control or maintain the rate or speed of a machine or process so that it operates properly
regulation|a rule or directive made and maintained by an authority
reinforce|strengthen or support, especially with additional personnel or material
reject|dismiss as inadequate, inappropriate, or not to one's taste
relate|make or show a connection between;have reference to
related|belonging to the same family, group, or type;connected
relation|the way in which two or more concepts, objects, or people are connected;a relative
relationship|the way in which two or more people or things are connected, or the state of being connected
relative|considered in relation or proportion to something else;a person connected by blood or marriage
relax|make or become less tense or anxious
release|allow or enable to escape from confinement;set free;make available to the public
relevant|closely connected or appropriate to what is being done or considered
relief|a feeling of reassurance and relaxation following release from anxiety or distress
religion|the belief in and worship of a superhuman controlling power, especially a personal God or gods
religious|relating to or believing in a religion
rely|depend on with full trust or confidence
remain|continue to exist, especially after other similar people or things have ceased to exist
remaining|still in existence, present, or available
remarkable|worthy of attention;striking;extraordinary
remember|have in or be able to bring to one's mind an awareness of someone or something from the past
remind|cause someone to remember someone or something
remote|situated far from the main centers of population;distant
remove|take something away or off from the position occupied
rent|a tenant's regular payment to a landlord for the use of property or land
repair|restore something damaged, faulty, or worn to a good condition
repeat|say again something one has already said;do something again
replace|take the place of;put something back in a previous place or position
reply|say something in response to something someone has said;an answer
report|give a spoken or written account of something that one has observed, heard, done, or investigated
reporter|a person who reports news or conducts interviews for newspapers or broadcasts
represent|be entitled or appointed to act or speak for someone;constitute or amount to
representation|the action of speaking or acting on behalf of someone;the description or portrayal of someone or something
representative|typical of a class or group;a person chosen to act or speak for another or others
republican|relating to or characteristic of a republic;a person advocating or supporting republican government
reputation|the beliefs or opinions that are generally held about someone or something
request|an act of asking politely or formally for something
require|need for a particular purpose;demand as necessary
requirement|a thing that is needed or wanted;a necessary condition
research|the systematic investigation into and study of materials and sources in order to establish facts and reach new conclusions
researcher|a person who carries out academic or scientific research
resemble|have qualities or features, especially those of appearance, in common with someone or something
reservation|the action of reserving something;a qualification to an expression of agreement or approval
resident|a person who lives somewhere on a long-term basis
resist|withstand the action or effect of;try to prevent by action or argument
resistance|the refusal to accept or comply with something;the ability not to be affected by something
resolution|a firm decision to do or not to do something;the quality of being determined
resolve|settle or find a solution to a problem or contentious matter;decide firmly on a course of action
resort|a place that is a popular destination for vacations or recreation;the action of turning to and adopting a strategy
resource|a stock or supply of money, materials, staff, and other assets that can be drawn on
respect|a feeling of deep admiration for someone or something elicited by their abilities, qualities, or achievements
respond|say something in reply;react quickly or positively to a stimulus
respondent|a defendant in a lawsuit, especially one in an appeals or divorce case
response|a verbal or written answer
responsibility|the state or fact of having a duty to deal with something or of having control over someone
responsible|having an obligation to do something, or having control over or care for someone, as part of one's job or role
rest|cease work or movement in order to relax, refresh oneself, or recover strength;the remaining part of something
restaurant|a place where people pay to sit and eat meals that are cooked and served on the premises
restore|bring back a previous state, practice, or situation;return to a former condition
restrict|put a limit on;keep under control
restriction|a limiting condition or measure, especially a legal one
result|a consequence, effect, or outcome of something
retain|continue to have something;keep possession of;absorb and continue to hold a substance
retire|leave one's job and cease to work, typically upon reaching the normal age for leaving service
retirement|the action or fact of leaving one's job and ceasing to work
return|come or go back to a place or person;give, put, or send something back
reveal|make previously unknown or secret information known to others
revenue|income, especially when of a company or organization and of a substantial nature
review|a formal assessment of something with the intention of instituting change if necessary;examine or assess formally
revolution|a forcible overthrow of a government or social order in favor of a new system;a dramatic and wide-reaching change
rhythm|a strong, regular repeated pattern of movement or sound
rice|a swamp grass which is widely cultivated as a source of food, especially in Asia
rich|having a great deal of money or assets;wealthy;plentiful
rid|make someone or something free of an unwanted person or thing
ride|sit on and control the movement of an animal, typically a horse;be carried or travel on or in a vehicle
rifle|a gun, especially one fired from shoulder level, having a long spirally grooved barrel to make a bullet spin
right|morally good, justified, or acceptable;true or correct as a matter of fact;the direction opposite of left
ring|a small circular band, typically of precious metal, worn on a finger;a sound made by a bell
rise|move from a lower position to a higher one;come or go up;an increase in number, size, or quality
risk|a situation involving exposure to danger;the possibility that something unpleasant will happen
river|a large natural stream of water flowing in a channel to the sea, a lake, or another such stream
road|a wide way leading from one place to another, especially one with a specially prepared surface which vehicles can use
rock|the solid mineral material forming part of the surface of the earth and other similar planets;move gently to and fro
role|an actor's part in a play, movie, etc.;the function assumed or part played by a person or thing in a particular situation
roll|move in a particular direction by turning over and over on an axis;a cylinder formed by turning flexible material over and over on itself
romantic|of, characterized by, or suggestive of an idealized view of reality;conducive to or characterized by the expression of love
roof|the structure forming the upper covering of a building or vehicle
room|space that can be occupied or where something can be done;a part of a building enclosed by walls, a floor, and a ceiling
root|the part of a plant which attaches it to the ground, conveying water and nourishment;the basic cause, source, or origin of something
rope|a length of strong cord made by twisting together strands of natural fibers or synthetic material
rose|a prickly bush or shrub that typically bears fragrant flowers, widely grown in gardens;a pinkish-red color
rough|having an uneven or irregular surface;not smooth or level;not gentle
roughly|in a way that is not exact or precise;approximately
round|shaped like a circle or cylinder;a circular course or route
route|a way or course taken in getting from a starting point to a destination
routine|a sequence of actions regularly followed;a fixed program
row|a number of people or things in a more or less straight line;propel a boat with oars
royal|having the status of a king or queen or a member of their family
rub|move one's hand or a cloth repeatedly back and forth on the surface of something with firm pressure
rubber|a tough elastic polymeric substance made from the latex of a tropical plant or synthetically
rude|offensively impolite or ill-mannered
ruin|the physical destruction or disintegration of something or the state of being destroyed;the remains of a building that has been destroyed
rule|one of a set of explicit or understood regulations or principles governing conduct;exercise ultimate power or authority over an area
run|move at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all the feet on the ground at the same time
running|the action or movement of a runner;the management of a company or organization
rural|in, relating to, or characteristic of the countryside rather than the town
rush|move with urgent haste;a sudden quick movement of people or things
sad|feeling or showing sorrow;unhappy
safe|protected from or not exposed to danger or risk;not likely to be harmed
safety|the condition of being protected from or unlikely to cause danger, risk, or injury
sail|a piece of material extended on a mast to catch the wind and propel a boat;travel in a boat with sails
sake|for the purpose of;in the interest of;out of consideration for
salad|a cold dish of various mixtures of raw or cooked vegetables, usually seasoned with oil or a dressing
salary|a fixed regular payment, typically paid on a monthly basis, made by an employer to an employee
sale|the exchange of a commodity for money;the action of selling something
salt|a white crystalline substance that gives seawater its characteristic taste and is used for seasoning or preserving food
same|identical;not different;unchanged
sample|a small part or quantity intended to show what the whole is like;a specimen
sanction|a threatened penalty for disobeying a law or rule;official permission or approval for an action
sand|a loose granular substance, typically pale yellowish brown, resulting from the erosion of siliceous and other rocks
satellite|an artificial body placed in orbit around the earth or moon or another planet in order to collect information or for communication
satisfaction|fulfillment of one's wishes, expectations, or needs, or the pleasure derived from this
satisfy|meet the expectations, needs, or desires of someone;fulfill
sauce|a liquid or semiliquid substance served with or used in preparing food
save|keep safe or rescue someone or something from harm or danger;keep and store up something for future use
say|utter words so as to convey information, an opinion, a feeling or intention, or a question
scale|each of the small, thin bony plates protecting the skin of fish and reptiles;a set of numbers, amounts, etc., used to measure or compare the level of something;climb up or over
scandal|an action or event regarded as morally or legally wrong and causing general public outrage
scare|cause great fear or nervousness in;frighten
scared|fearful;frightened
scenario|a postulated sequence or development of events;a written outline of a movie, novel, or stage work
scene|the place where an incident in real life or fiction occurs;a sequence of continuous action in a play or movie
schedule|a plan for carrying out a process or procedure, giving lists of intended events and times
scheme|a large-scale systematic plan or arrangement for attaining a particular object or putting a particular idea into effect
scholar|a specialist in a particular branch of study, especially the humanities;a distinguished academic
scholarship|academic study or achievement;learning of a high level;a grant made to support a student's education
school|an institution for educating children
science|the intellectual and practical activity encompassing the systematic study of the structure and behavior of the physical and natural world through observation and experiment
scientific|based on or characterized by the methods and principles of science
scientist|a person who is studying or has expert knowledge of one or more of the natural or physical sciences
scope|the extent of the area or subject matter that something deals with or to which it is relevant
score|the number of points, goals, runs, etc., achieved in a game or competition;achieve a certain score
scream|give a long, loud, piercing cry or cries expressing excitement, great emotion, or pain
screen|a flat panel or area on an electronic device on which images and data are displayed;conceal, protect, or shelter
script|handwriting as distinct from print;the written text of a play, movie, or broadcast
sea|the expanse of salt water that covers most of the earth's surface and surrounds its landmasses
search|try to find something by looking or otherwise seeking carefully and thoroughly
season|each of the four divisions of the year (spring, summer, autumn, and winter) marked by particular weather patterns
seat|a thing made or used for sitting on, such as a chair or bench
second|constituting number two in a sequence;a unit of time equal to one-sixtieth of a minute
secret|not known or seen or not meant to be known or seen by others
secretary|a person employed by an individual or in an office to assist with correspondence, keep records, and make appointments
section|any of the more or less distinct parts into which something is or may be divided or from which it is made up
sector|an area or portion that is distinct from others, especially in an economy or a city
secure|fixed or fastened so as to not give way, become loose, or be lost;certain to remain safe
security|the state of being free from danger or threat
see|perceive with the eyes;discern visually;understand
seed|a flowering plant's unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant
seek|attempt to find something;attempt to obtain or achieve
seem|give the impression or sensation of being something or having a particular quality
segment|each of the parts into which something is or may be divided
seize|take hold of suddenly and forcibly;take an opportunity eagerly and decisively
select|carefully choose as being the best or most suitable
selection|the action or fact of carefully choosing someone or something as being the best or most suitable
self|a person's essential being that distinguishes them from others, especially considered as the object of introspection
sell|give or hand over something in exchange for money
senate|the smaller upper assembly in the US Congress, most US states, France, and other countries
senator|a member of a senate
send|cause to go or be taken to a particular destination;arrange for the delivery of
senior|of a more advanced age;of a high or higher rank or status
sense|a faculty by which the body perceives an external stimulus;a feeling that something is the case
sensitive|quick to detect or respond to slight changes, signals, or influences;easily damaged, injured, or distressed
sentence|a set of words that is complete in itself, typically containing a subject and predicate;the punishment assigned to a defendant found guilty
separate|cause to move or be apart;forming or viewed as a unit apart or by itself
sequence|a particular order in which related events, movements, or things follow each other
series|a number of similar or related things coming one after another
serious|demanding or characterized by careful consideration or application;significant or worrying
seriously|in a solemn or considered manner;to a severe or worrying degree
serve|perform duties or services for another person or an organization
service|the action of helping or doing work for someone;a system supplying a public need
session|a period devoted to a particular activity;a formal meeting of a deliberative assembly
set|put, lay, or stand something in a specified place or position;a group of things that belong together
setting|the place or type of surroundings where something is positioned or where an event takes place
settle|resolve or reach an agreement about an argument or problem;go and live somewhere permanently
seven|the number equivalent to the sum of six and one;7
several|more than two but not many
severe|of something bad or undesirable, very great;intense;strict or harsh
sex|either of the two main categories (male and female) into which humans and most other living things are divided on the basis of their reproductive functions
sexual|relating to the instincts, physiological processes, and activities connected with physical attraction or intimate physical contact between individuals
shade|comparative darkness and coolness caused by shelter from direct sunlight
shadow|a dark area or shape produced by a body coming between rays of light and a surface
shake|move an object up and down or from side to side with rapid, forceful, jerky movements
shall|used with first person pronouns to express a strong assertion or intention;expressing an instruction or command
shape|the external form or appearance characteristic of someone or something;the outline of an area
share|a part or portion of a larger amount which is divided among a number of people;possess a quality or experience with other people
sharp|having an edge or point that is able to cut or pierce something;producing a sudden, piercing sensation
she|used to refer to a woman, girl, or female animal previously mentioned or easily identified
sheet|a large rectangular piece of cotton or other fabric, used on a bed;a broad, thin piece of paper or metal
shelf|a flat length of wood or other rigid material, attached to a wall or forming part of a piece of furniture, that provides a surface for the storage or display of objects
shell|the hard protective outer case of a mollusk, crustacean, or other invertebrate
shelter|a place giving temporary protection from bad weather or danger
shift|move or cause to move from one place to another, especially over a small distance;a slight change in position or direction
shine|give out a bright light;be excellent or conspicuous at an activity
ship|a large boat for transporting people or goods by sea or other large bodies of water
shirt|a garment for the upper body, made of cotton or a similar fabric, with a collar, sleeves, and buttons down the front
shock|a sudden upsetting or surprising event or experience;an acute medical condition associated with a fall in blood pressure
shoe|a covering for the foot, typically made of leather, having a sturdy sole and not reaching above the ankle
shoot|kill or wound a person or animal with a bullet or arrow;move suddenly and rapidly
shop|a building or part of a building where goods or services are sold;a retail establishment
shopping|the activity of buying goods from shops
shore|the land along the edge of a sea, lake, or wide river
short|of a small length in space or time;not lasting long
shot|the firing of a gun or cannon;a photograph;an attempt
should|used to indicate obligation, duty, or correctness;used to indicate a likely future event
shoulder|the upper joint of the human arm and the part of the body between this and the neck
shout|speak or cry out with a loud voice
show|allow or cause to be visible;a spectacle or display for public entertainment
shower|a brief and usually light fall of rain, hail, sleet, or snow;a cubicle in which a person stands under a spray of water to wash
shrug|raise one's shoulders slightly and momentarily to express doubt, ignorance, or indifference
shut|move something into a position to block an opening;close
sick|affected by physical or mental illness
side|a position to the left or right of an object, place, or central point;a competing team or group
sigh|emit a long, deep, audible breath expressing sadness, relief, tiredness, or a similar feeling
sight|the faculty or power of seeing;a thing that one sees or that can be seen
sign|a gesture or action used to convey information or an instruction;an object, quality, or event whose presence or occurrence indicates the probable presence or occurrence of something else
signal|a gesture, action, or sound that is used to convey information or instructions
significance|the quality of being worthy of attention;importance;the meaning to be found in words or events
significant|sufficiently great or important to be worthy of attention;noteworthy
significantly|in a sufficiently great or important way as to be worthy of attention
silence|complete absence of sound
silent|not making or accompanied by any sound
silver|a precious shiny grayish-white metal, the chemical element of atomic number 47
similar|resembling without being identical
similarly|in a similar way
simple|easily understood or done;presenting no difficulty;plain, basic, or uncomplicated in form
simply|in a straightforward or plain manner;just;merely
sin|an immoral act considered to be a transgression against divine law
since|in the intervening period between the time mentioned and the time under consideration;for the reason that
sing|make musical sounds with the voice, especially words with a set tune
singer|a person who sings, especially professionally
single|only one;not one of several;unmarried
sink|go down below the surface of something, especially of a liquid;a fixed basin with a water supply and a drain
sir|a formal or polite term of address for a man
sister|a woman or girl who has one or both parents in common with another person
sit|adopt or be in a position in which one's weight is supported by one's buttocks rather than one's feet
site|an area of ground on which a town, building, or monument is constructed;a website
situation|a set of circumstances in which one finds oneself;a location and its surroundings
six|the number equivalent to the sum of three and three;6
size|the relative extent of something;a thing's overall dimensions or magnitude
ski|each of a pair of long, narrow runners attached to boots for traveling over snow
skill|the ability to do something well;expertise
skin|the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal
sky|the region of the atmosphere and outer space seen from the earth
slave|a person who is the legal property of another and is forced to obey them
sleep|a condition of body and mind which typically recurs for several hours every night, in which the nervous system is inactive
sleeve|the part of a garment that wholly or partly covers a person's arm
slice|a thin, broad piece of food, such as bread, meat, or cake, cut from a larger portion
slide|move along a smooth surface while maintaining continuous contact with it
slight|small in degree;inconsiderable
slightly|to a small degree;not considerably
slip|lose one's footing and slide unintentionally for a short distance;a small piece of paper
slow|moving or operating at a low speed;taking a long time
slowly|at a slow speed;not quickly
small|of a size that is less than normal or usual
smart|having or showing a quick-witted intelligence;clean, tidy, and well dressed
smell|the faculty or power of perceiving odors or scents by means of the organs in the nose
smile|form one's features into a pleased, kind, or amused expression, typically with the corners of the mouth turned up
smoke|a visible suspension of carbon or other particles in air, typically one emitted from a burning substance
smooth|having an even and regular surface or consistency;free from projections or indentations
snap|break or cause to break suddenly and completely, typically with a sharp cracking sound
